private_information: I am agent_1 and I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E.
I may only move a disk if it is the top disk on its peg.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the global Tower of Hanoi target configuration by proposing valid primitive moves for the disks I can move.

private_information: I am agent_2 and I am allowed to move disks: F, G, H, I, J.
I may only move a disk if it is the top disk on its peg.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the global Tower of Hanoi target configuration by proposing valid primitive moves for the disks I can move.

private_information: I am agent_3 and I am allowed to move disks: K, L, M, N, O.
I may only move a disk if it is the top disk on its peg.
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the global Tower of Hanoi target configuration by proposing valid primitive moves for the disks I can move.

private_information: I coordinate the proposals from the three agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward planner.
I must keep agent actions distinct and ensure the produced PDDL respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk move restrictions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent proposals into a single coherent PDDL domain and problem that solves the given Tower of Hanoi instance using FastDownward.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi with three pegs: left, middle, right.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom: F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top to bottom: A, E; right peg top to bottom: B, C, D.
Disk size ordering from smallest to largest is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Rules: only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 can move A through E, agent_2 can move F through J, agent_3 can move K through O.
Primitive move format requested: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Propose an ordered list of valid primitive moves you can perform given the public information and your private information. Do not produce PDDL. Produce moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the restriction that you may only move disks A, B, C, D, E and only when they are the top disk of a peg. Keep the move list concise and only include moves you are responsible for.
proposal.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: achieve the goal configuration described in public information. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves following the requested format. Do not assume control over disks you are not allowed to move.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Propose an ordered list of valid primitive moves you can perform given the public information and your private information. Do not produce PDDL. Produce moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the restriction that you may only move disks F, G, H, I, J and only when they are the top disk of a peg. Keep the move list concise and only include moves you are responsible for.
proposal.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: achieve the goal configuration described in public information. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves following the requested format. Do not assume control over disks you are not allowed to move.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_3. Propose an ordered list of valid primitive moves you can perform given the public information and your private information. Do not produce PDDL. Produce moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the restriction that you may only move disks K, L, M, N, O and only when they are the top disk of a peg. Keep the move list concise and only include moves you are responsible for.
proposal.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: achieve the goal configuration described in public information. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves following the requested format. Do not assume control over disks you are not allowed to move.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the move proposals from agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3. Resolve ordering and ensure global legality under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent move restrictions. Produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward planner. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with the agent name. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL must explicitly model disks A through O, pegs left, middle, right, disk size ordering, top-of-peg relations, and action preconditions that enforce both size constraints and the agent-specific move permissions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive ordered move proposals from each agent. The public information is: {environment->public_information}. Agent private information is: {agents->agent_1->private_information}, {agents->agent_2->private_information}, {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Agent proposals are: {proposal_agent_1}, {proposal_agent_2}, {proposal_agent_3}. Integrate these proposals into a single correct plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem file suitable for FastDownward that implements the integrated plan while preserving agent action identities. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
